intro: Theophrasta hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's theophrasta, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountain range in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Theophrasta hookeri is often found growing in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes.
